name: 4,5-dimethoxy-3-iodobenzaldehyde
Reason: 4,5-dimethoxy-3-iodobenzaldehyde has a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzaldehyde, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The methoxy groups (–O–) increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and molecular weight, estimated at +10 °C each. The iodine atom (I) raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at +5 °C. The presence of two fused aromatic rings (–O–) adds to the melting point due to increased molecular rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at +25 °C for each additional fused ring.
